ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Telling stories was a great section that taught the importance of narrative in all aspects of society and humanity. The content was very interesting from a philosophical perspective. In terms of the standard Engl 114 skills, they're pretty basic and probably stuff you already have seen. Craig does do a good job explaining them though and your writing will get better purely because the prompts will force you to expand from the AP Lit/Lang essays you might have been writing before. Since the prompts are complicated you'll have to learn to build a complex argument castle, as Craig explains, and you will want to keep the writing as direct as possible to avoid confusion. Craigs feedback is very detailed and helpful.
Writing effective claims, structured revision process, tangible methods to improve writing
academic writing, how to read and discuss literature
Improved writing skills, argumentative writing, and the revising process

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The content was usually very interesting although the readings could be dry on rare occasions. The essays force you to really focus on your writing in a way you probably haven't before. Discussions were great near the beginning but sort of tapered off as the semester progressed. Great community feeling in the class.

strengths: i really enjoyed our readings and class discussions. it was well structured
weaknesses: the deadlines were really fast-paced, so you have to make sure you're staying on schedule with drafts
Strengths: the prof, the revising process, the Memento unit, the freedom with the final research paper

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. If you need a writing credit this is definitely one of your better options. Craig has a great personality. You get great feedback and your writing will improve. The Engl 114 curriculum seems kind of dumb and although they say its very different from the 5 paragraph essays you wrote in high school, its really not. The biggest con is you don't get a lot of flexibility in your writing style and choices.
YES!! Take it!! Craig is an incredible professor. The subject is so interesting, and Craig facilitates awesome class discussions
yes! i really liked the content and definitely improved in my writing
Highly recommend, huge boost to writing abilities that many people should experience at least once
